attributes.action: Ehler Danlos Syndrome NEEDS doctors knowledge! FUND IT!
attributes.background: Ehlers Danlos Syndrome has different types, the common link between them is Pain. Most people affected by this illness aren't diagnosed until later on in their lives.It is mostly an invisible illness and can ruin your life completely. THERE IS NO CURE! Most doctors don't know what it is.#makeachange
attributes.additional_details: I suffer from ehler danlos syndrome and life is hard at the best of times, when something goes wrong you would think a doctor to know at least a bit of background about it. NOT EDS! This is horrifying as so many people go undiagnosed and refused the help they need to manage it! Not all of us with EDS can make it to America for treatment so we need something set up to help people in the 🇬🇧. Every time a doctor says "i don't know what that is" it saddens me. Please help to change this😔

attributes.action: Stop the UK from recognising child marriage conducted abroad as legal.
attributes.background:
The UK recognises child marriage provided they were conducted "legally" abroad & also for benefit purposes.
It is illegal to marry under 18 yrs of age in the UK (16 years with parental consent) & these child marriages should not be recognised by the UK in any form. The adult should be prosecuted.
attributes.additional_details:
Today Save the Children estimated that a girl marries under the age of 15 years every 7 second seconds within the world.
In recognising the child marriages of immigrants to the UK (including for benefit purposes) we do nothing to stop this child abuse.

attributes.action: Stop UK residents driving on foreign licences
attributes.background: The UK driving test is in place to ensure EVERY driver is safe to use our roads. But due to legislation EU/foreign drivers are able to drive for set periods/70years old on their countries licence. We MUST improve road safety, by ensuring EVERY driver living in UK undergoes OUR test.
attributes.additional_details:
In 2011 alone 80k licences were exchanged that's 80k people who have NEVER taken the UK test.
DVSA have clamped down on fraudulent tests, claiming 'the driving test is there to ensure all drivers have the skills & knowledge to use the roads safely & responsibly' 
This must be extended to truly ensure ALL drivers have this knowledge.

attributes.action: Minimum sentences for police officers who lie while performing their duties.
attributes.background: Police officers swear an oath to act with the highest level of integrity. They choose to put themselves up as a beacon of virtue and honesty and believe their uniform sets them apart. They are placed above other members of society and are expected to act with honesty and integrity at all times.
attributes.additional_details:
A recent petition has been drafted requesting minimum sentencing for assaulting a police officer.

A police officer dons the uniform and in their own minds view themselves as different.

They rely on this difference when making statements that they know will be given more credence than contradictory statements made by "ordinary" members of the public.

The abuse of this power should be met with the full anger of the law they perverted.

attributes.action: Change the child tax credits from two children to four.
attributes.background: Lower income families and working families on low income need the extra help. Not many families have just two children and some people are now pregnant and at risk of miscarriage due to the stress of money worries.

attributes.action: Cover mental health under The Equality Act 2010
attributes.background: The Equality Act covers the same groups that were protected by existing equality legislation – age, disability, gender reassignment, race, religion or belief, sex, sexual orientation, marriage and civil partnership and pregnancy and maternity. These are now called ‘protected characteristics’.
attributes.additional_details: 1 in 4 people in the UK will experience a mental health problem each year. Just because you cannot see a disability, which it is, doesn't mean it does not exist and should not be under the Equality Act 2010. They say it "can" be covered if there is proof it effects day to day life, but that is unacceptable as it can be hard to prove that. People all over the country suffer. Jobs, benefits, health all put strain on people where they cannot cope, mental health should be a protected characteristic.

attributes.action: Partition 7 new British Crown Dependencies out of UK and EU; keeping UK in EU.
attributes.background:
Partition 7 new British Crown Dependencies out of UK and EU so Leavers can Leave EU. Keep post-Partition UK a full EU member state (do not activate Art.50) so Remainers can Remain in EU.
Precedents: Isle of Man, Jersey & Guernsey are BCDs outside EU.
When Greenland left Denmark, Denmark stayed EU
attributes.additional_details:
Full Petition Text & Detailed List of the 7 new BCDs' areas (with % Leave vote figures): http://tinyurl.com/ntg88ta
Maps of 7 BCDs: 
http://tinyurl.com/orygvny 
http://tinyurl.com/ogb3qnk
Further:
UK Govt to assign finance & civil servants to help each of new BCDs get its Govt / Parliament set up.
Defence still by UK; major roads, rail, power grids & nuclear reactors stay UK territory; later on BCDs contribute finances. 
Reciprocal NHS Arrangement between BCDs & UK (like Isle of Man & UK now).

attributes.action: End the 'Special Relationship' with the USA in the event of a Trump presidency.
attributes.background: After 580,000 petitioned to ban his entry into the UK, Trump may become president. Our Special Relationship means the British people may be dragged into economic, political and military conflict by a hated man. In this time of vulnerability, the UK must distance itself from Trump's America.
attributes.additional_details: In a campaign mired in racism, xenophobia, extremism, and sexual assault, Donald Trump has outlined plans which, due to the US/UK 'Special Relationship', may endanger British citizens and interests. This includes nuclear proliferation in Korea and Japan, the abandonment of NATO, forcing Mexico to pay for a border wall, ground troops in Syria, torture, opposition to China, and potential war with Iran and North Korea. If Trump wins, the UK must take a stand against his administration.

attributes.action: Establish Fibromyalgia clinics  to improve services for chronic pain in the Uk.
attributes.background: Fibromylgia is a chronic. syndrome affecting 1 in 20 of the population. Although it can be diagnosed easily by Rheumotologists,  GP's in local surgeries are often unable to make a diagnosis, or provide the level of medical care and support which is necessary .
attributes.additional_details:
Fibromyalgia is identified by pain in all 4 quadrants of the body, chronic fatigue and sleeping disorders. It is a complex condition involving many other symptoms from Irritable Bowel Syndrome, cognitive impairment, poor and poor co ordination to severe headaches ,Temporal Mandible Joint pain , and many others.
Providing clinics which run in a similar manner to diabetic clinics, would provide a higher standard of support for Fibromyalgia patients.These clinics are being trialled in some parts of the UK reducing trips to A and E departments,  clinic waiting times and the number of visits to a variety of other clinics.

attributes.action: Make Public Transport Strike Action Illegal - Put in Alternative Dispute Process
attributes.background: The Southern Trains series of strikes has left the paying commuter helpless with no resolution in sight. The status quo is not working and it is unfair for the public to suffer and be a pawn in these disputes. Strike action should be illegal and an alternative dispute method sought.
attributes.additional_details: http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/uk-england-38296623

attributes.action: Fund the promise: Priority NHS treatment for War Pension attributable injuries
attributes.background: Successive Governments have promised since 1948, that War Pensioners would receive priority treatment for attributable injuries caused by their Military Service. In 2008 The Govt issued guidelines to receive priority treatment. This promise, a duty of care, to Military Personnel must be upheld.
attributes.additional_details: In 2008 The Government issued guidelines stating that:  If you are in receipt of a war pension award, be it a gratuity (one off payment) or a weekly pension, you are entitled under an NHS Executive Guideline HSG(97)31 to receive priority treatment for the accepted conditions on your war pension. Also, in 2008, this guideline was extended to include conditions that are not accepted under your war pension but could be caused from your service in the Armed forces.  The NHS does not honour this.

attributes.action: Make all take-away and fast food outlets use compostable containers and cutlery.
attributes.background: I was inspired by the same ethos used at Glastonbury festival where all cutlery is wooden and the containers are made from expanded or blown cardboard, even when serving gravy. It will aid the recycling of food waste. We need to reduce the volume of plastics going to landfill.

attributes.action: Remove status from charities paying staff more than 3 times the average wage.
attributes.background: Charities in the UK should have their charitable status removed if they pay any of their staff more than three times the average wage. Why should a pensioner on less than £150 a week give £5 to a charity that pays a CEO £200k? In 2016-2017 three times the average wage is £82,500. Many get more.
attributes.additional_details: By way of examples - Parkinson's UK has 10 staff earning between £60,000 and £130,000, The Royal British Legion has 26 staff earning between £60,000 and £160,000, Help for Heroes has 17 staff earning between £60,000 and £110,000 and Cancer Research UK has 219 staff earning between £60,000 and £250,000.

attributes.action: Better pay for support workers and carers they are the backbone of this country.
attributes.background: Carers, supported living and especially nursing homes, are the backbone of this country. Right now, the care sector and social welfare sector is suffering to the point of collapse. It is the backbone of this country. In order to attract a quality of care, the rate of pay MUST be increased.
attributes.additional_details:
https://www.theguardian.com/social-care-network/2015/jan/20/care-workers-better-pay-conditions

This article in the guardian more or less sums up the whole situation. 

If we are to attract a quality of staff that is prepared to actually "care" then we must give those staff the incentive to come and do so. Right now, the wage is slow low it is almost in design to attract abuse, negativity and bad care. And those who do care are pushed to their limit financially and emotionally. This must change.

attributes.action: Build Homes for our Heroes. Armed forces personnel deserve support from the UK.
attributes.background: Our Armed Forces are heroes.  We believe that the Government should build homes for them to help them integrate back into society and in order to adapt to civilian life.

attributes.action: We request the government ban the sale of cotton style rodent bedding in shops.
attributes.background:
Cotton style (Cotton, wool, vegetable fibres) nesting material is harmful to pets yet is still sold in a number of shops nationwide. See Additional details for further information. 
I lost two hamsters to the bedding and after discovering it had happened to hundreds more, I started this campaign.
attributes.additional_details:
View http://www.hamsteradvice.com/ban-fluffy-bedding.html for information on how the bedding affects animals. It details how it causes harm internally, by causing blockages in the stomach and also wrapping round limbs which results in potential self-amputation.

The material needs to be banned from pet shops, it has claimed the lives of thousands of pets and continues to do so with the lack of awareness on the dangers.

attributes.action: Delay the April 2017 VED (Car Tax) changes until a better idea is proposed
attributes.background: The 2017 changes will damage the car industry and buyer of both new and used cars from April 2017. The changes do nothing to encourage manufacturers to improve efficiency and do nothing to encourage buyers to buy more fuel and emissions efficient cars. Changes are a retrograde step
attributes.additional_details:
The details of the new rates are available on gov website - https://www.gov.uk/government/uploads/system/uploads/attachment_data/file/534511/ved-reform-briefing-for-motor-industry.pdf
This change increases costs for drivers ;
First year tax from £0 for cars between 1 and 130g/km CO2 to between £10 and £160.  
It increases annual cost for these cars from £20-£110 to £140 for all
Adds a £310 premium on top where list price is over £40,000. This lasts 5 years so affects the used car market also.

attributes.action: Stop ALL spending by UK Gov on Foreign Aid and divert it to the Care Budget.
attributes.background: We can't afford to look after our own citizens, but still send money overseas, why?  We must no longer neglect our own citizens, who worked hard to build our country and paid into the very same system that now neglects them but sends money to countries that do not need it!
attributes.additional_details: Raising council tax to pay for care, when it will not be enough or guaranteed to actually be spent wisely on care (that's if it gets into the care pot at all!).  We need to focus on those that paid into the system and look at the ways we should be working with everyone in our communities to integrate care and develop more beneficial caring environments for the future benefit of all.

attributes.action: Change the age of the 30hrs free childcare to start at age 1 for working parents
attributes.background: The government are increasing the childcare hours from 15 to 30 for 3 and 4 year olds, but we as working parents are still struggling to pay for childcare for our babies as most women return to work after 9 months.  We want the age changed to start the 30hrs from the age of 1.

attributes.action: People who work in ALL places of Worship must be DBS and OFSTED checked
attributes.background: I was abused by the Imam at the mosque I attended in the 1980s. I went to court, attended trials and finally got the guilty verdict.  He was sentenced to 11 and half years but absconded the next day. I’m waiting for him to be extradited back. I wrote a book in 2012 about my story, called “Brutal”.
attributes.additional_details:
Brutal By Nabila Sharma 2012
Hafiz Rahman sentenced to 11 and half years at Wolverhampton Crown Court October 2016.

attributes.action: Dissolve the House of Lords and replace it with a new appointment process
attributes.background: We are in a situation where the house of commons appears to not represent the working class people of Great Britain. It is seen by most working class people to be an extension of the House of Lords. We need a balance of wealthy people and poor people to correctly govern the UK.
attributes.additional_details: At present we have no balance, both houses are full of highly educated individuals most from privileged backgrounds.To restore balance we need a house to represent the not so fortunate of the UK i.e low paid workers, people who live in poorer areas,  people without an education, people without the chance to change their lives. I propose we dissolve the House of Lords and replace it with a cross section of society who are selected in much the same way we already make selections for Jury service.

attributes.action: A Law to give temp shelter to all rough sleepers if temps are predicted at Zero.
attributes.background:
Put a Law in place, that forces local authorities to give shelter to all rough sleepers should temperatures be predicted at below zero. 
Just today, this guy died on our streets, make it stop
http://www.mirror.co.uk/news/uk-news/tragedy-unknown-homeless-man-found-9372526?ICID=FB_mirror_main
attributes.additional_details:
Every year these guys face all weather conditions, and it is not acceptable by any means, there should be a law placed that these guys know that should the weather drop to zero they will be allocated some shelter, should they want it. 
Each local authority should be forced to allocate shelter by the Government, and I ask that a law be put in place to protect those in this difficult situation.

attributes.action: Enable U.K. roaming
attributes.background: Not all mobile telephone networks cover all areas of the UK. Roaming would allow all subscribers to use all networks
attributes.additional_details: The National Infrastructure Report last year high-lighted significant deficiencies in existing networks' coverage

attributes.action: Support workers/health care assistants to be paid a min of £10 per hour.
attributes.background: I work as a senior support worker on a dementia unit.  My responsibilities are vast in safeguarding vulnerable people. Most support staff working in the care sector will tell you how demanding the job role is. A true reflection of hourly pay is needed for what our job role involves.

attributes.action: Stop county councils from increasing council tax by more than annual inflation.
attributes.background: Surrey County Council have recently stated that they are proposing a 15% increase in council tax, when the current annual inflation rate at December 2016 is only around 2%. It is not fair or affordable for the public to pay so much more than the rate of inflation due to the council's inefficiencies.
attributes.additional_details:
Articles in local Surrey Mirror press:

19/1/2017: http://www.surreymirror.co.uk/surrey-county-council-announces-plans-for-15-per-cent-council-tax-hike/story-30070982-detail/story.html

23/12/2016: http://www.surreymirror.co.uk/cash-strapped-surrey-county-council-refuses-to-rule-out-eye-watering-200-rise-in-council-tax/story-30006252-detail/story.html?f8g6fa

attributes.action: “That there shall be an early parliamentary general election.”
attributes.background: To remedy the uncertainty caused by the outcome of the Referendum on U. K. membership of the European Union, that the House of Commons have a motion laid before it by the end of March 2017 “That there shall be an early parliamentary general election.”
attributes.additional_details: The Fixed Term Parliaments Act 2011 provides for this, and if passed by a two-thirds majority, it is the only way for a general election to be held earlier than May 2020, other than a motion of no confidence in HMG passed by a simple majority.

attributes.action: Strip Thameslink franchise, bringing back a British Rail government run service
attributes.background: Thameslink have failed for years. Customer satisfaction is low and journeys unsafe and infrequent. We need a train service fit and reliable for the needs of London and UK economy. Strip Thameslink of franchise, stop blaming years of under funding and bring back British Rail government run trains.
attributes.additional_details: This petition demands the return of government run franchise not having profits put before customer levels of safety and satisfaction. Bring back a British Rail system for failing train companies and hold them accountable in the way failing NHS or schools are supported and improved. Make UK mirror London and open for business 24hrs

attributes.action: stop the sale of The Royal Citadel Plymouth Devon
attributes.background: The government is going ahead with the sale of The royal Citadel in the next 10 years. It has been the home for thousands of commandos, who look at it as the home and a place to remember the fall comrades. Once again we feel that we are being let down by our MPS WHO WILL NEVER UNDERSTAND LOYALTY.

attributes.action: Introduce personal safety & criminal action awareness training in schools in UK
attributes.background: We are teachers & self defence instructors that work with children of all ages and last year we surveyed a number of pupils in secondary schools in South Yorkshire. 6/10 freely admitted that they had a fear of violence from other pupils. 4/10 pupils freely admitted being attacked in the community.
attributes.additional_details: violent Crime figures are rising year by year and from 2015-2016 grow by 27%. Our survey showed that the fear of physical violence, harassment or abuse was making 2/10 children severely depressed and had a dramatic effect on the learner of others. The fear of peer pressure and threats of violence had a dramatic effect on Girls taking part Physical education. Only 2/10 children surveyed said they would know or be confident in what to do to protect themselves against aggression or violence,

attributes.action: Create a law that new buildings must have roofs covered in solar panels/plants.
attributes.background: Partially covering roofs with solar panels would help to reduce the building's carbon footprint. The plants would be used on roofs which don't face south. The plants would produce oxygen and also reduce the amount of energy needed to heat or cool a building and also create a place for birds to nest.
attributes.additional_details:
Similar laws have been put in place in San Fransisco and France. It is more cost effective to do this on new buildings than retrofit existing buildings.
For more information:
https://www.theguardian.com/world/2015/mar/20/france-decrees-new-rooftops-must-be-covered-in-plants-or-solar-panels

https://www.theguardian.com/environment/2016/apr/21/san-francisco-adopts-law-requiring-solar-panels-on-all-new-buildings

attributes.action: Remove  Disabled Families/Parents/Children from the Troubled Families Policy
attributes.background:
We request that you fully support Disabled Families complete removal from this program.
Plus support a full public consultation to be launched to investigate. 
Why it was even deemed acceptable in the first place for Disabled Families inclusion in this policy.
attributes.additional_details:
Troubled Families Policy. 
As it stands the categories are: 
Parents and children involved in crime or anti-social behaviour 
Children who have not been attending school regularly 
Children who need help 
Adults out of work or at risk of financial exclusion and young people at risk of worklessness 
Families affected by domestic violence and abuse 
Parents and children with a range of health problems.

attributes.action: Ignore the petition 'defining marriage as exclusively between 1 man & 1 woman'
attributes.background:
The UK is a leading country in the world for equal rights. Any petition sought to undermine this is detrimental to our society and any current influence we have in the world. 

Regardless of who you are, and who you love, everyone has the right to express that love and wed.

attributes.action: Demand a public enquiry into the MOD handling of military abuse claims in Iraq.
attributes.background: We want a public enquiry into the MOD's handling of historic abuse allegations brought against British Military personnel.

attributes.action: Increase the maximum sentence for those found guilty of cruelty to a child
attributes.background: Innocence.The innocence of a baby or child should be cherished. But not all think that way. Some people see that innocence as their's to take. They neglect, ill-treat and assault. We've all read the stories, cried and screamed in disbelief at the sentences. It is time to do something about it.
attributes.additional_details: Cruelty to a child under the Children and Young Persons Act 1933 s.1 carries a maximum sentence of 10 years imprisonment. It includes a range of offences; neglect, abandonment, assault and cruelty, whether carried out once or numerous times. Children who this Act is meant to protect will never get their stolen innocence back and they get no justice with a maximum sentence of 10 years for those who stole it. The maximum sentence for those found guilty of child cruelty needs to be increased.

attributes.action: free bus pass from the age of 60 for people living in England
attributes.background: People living in Scotland,Wales,N Ireland,and even London,can get a free bus pass.I feel that it discriminates against people living in England.

attributes.action: Ban the use of quad bikes dirt bikes on all public roads.
attributes.background: Dirt bikes & quad bikes are becoming a real nuisance on public roads & public parks all over the U.K. The police are unable to do anything. This needs to be stopped now before someone gets seriously hurt.

attributes.action:
Bring out Identity Cards that hold DNA
details for EVERYONE living/enters UK
attributes.background: it's time to get a world wide data base, starting with the UK. everyone either Born/living/entering the uk should have to submit their DNA & then receive a Biometric ID card a cross between a bank card & a driving licence type. the results of less police hours would out weigh the cost of the cards.
attributes.additional_details:
not only would they cut down police hours saving the force money, they would free up officers to do deal with more crimes. as well as tracking down rapists and killers (where DNA was found) a lot quicker they would also help family's that have lost loved ones due to horrific circumstances,
i,e where a body is either badly composed or mutilated, the police could check DNA database and say ok this is them meaning that the family will not have a life time of a horrific image of their loved ones.

attributes.action: Remove Corporate and Media Funding From the UK Political System.
attributes.background:
In order for the UK to have a true democracy, the interests of the electorate should be at the core of government policy. 
As long a big business and the media fund political parties, the interests of their sponsors and a desire to remain in power, prevents a government from fulfilling its duties.
attributes.additional_details:
Electoral funding should be minimised. It should be financed with public money, by a process that reflects an equal distribution to either parties or MPs. A process to be decided by parliament, if the motion is agreed. 
Media owners hold to much influence over voters. This does not benefit the electorate, but their own interests and is facilitated by their sponsorship of politics.
The same applies to corporations, in which MPs should be allowed no investments, financial (or positional) for life.

attributes.action: Give everyone the right to see a GP within 48 hours of making an appointment
attributes.background: Many patients in the UK are waiting up to a month to get a routine GP appointment. This puts patients at risk, places an intolerable burden on A&E departments and undermines efforts at preventative healthcare. The government should set a target that everyone can see a GP within 48 hours of asking.

attributes.action: Change car insurance law to insure driver rather than vehicle for road risks
attributes.background: Car insurance has been incomprehensibly expensive for years, only getting more expensive when you use your policy and make a claim. The biggest rip off from a consumer's point of view is for people who, for whatever reason, run more than one vehicle.
attributes.additional_details:
It is only physically possible to drive one vehicle at once so why are we paying a double premium? The largest portion of a vehicle insurance policy is Road risks so my proposition is a driver specific insurance for road risks and an optional, much smaller vehicle premium for fire and theft.

Multi car insurance policies do exist but their premiums don't represent the true risk to the insurance company, usually offering a maximum of a 25% discount in a very small number of cases.

attributes.action: Link a dog owners national Insurance number to microchip details.
attributes.background: I have owned dogs for over 25 years. I am passionate about rescues and the hard work they do to ensure a dogs welfare. I am livid! That animal abuse is not taken more seriously in this country. Animal abusers should be put on a list.
attributes.additional_details: The amount of animal abuse videos I see the amount of dogs in rescues who struggle to make ends meet could be lowered. Micro chipping is law now in this country for dogs. Why can we not pass a law that states that when you get a dog you have to attach your national insurance number to said dog?? If you sell this dog rehome or put no rescue or even dump and you do not change NI details any costs incurred should be billed to the last NI on record, this way any costs made could be received back.

attributes.action: Have a vote of no confidence in the Lord Chancellor
attributes.background: Liz Truss's response to the attacks in the press on the Law Lords is completely inadequate: she doesn't condemn them for saying the ruling was politically motivated but she does refer to the government's intention to appeal to the Supreme Court. She should speak for the judiciary, not the government

attributes.action: Call a referendum on the UK remaining in the European Economic Area (EEA).
attributes.background: The UK referendum rejected membership of the EU but voters were unable to express a preference for remaining in the European Economic Area (EEA - the Single Market). The most logical and democratic way to resolve this question is to have a new referendum with a new question.
attributes.additional_details: The EEA is the single market - it is Europe without Federalist aspirations. It allows the UK to trade freely with the EU. The UK is a signatory of this agreement and the "presumption of continuity" allows the UK to remain within the EEA if we so choose; there is no mechanism to eject us. The result of the EU referendum has been distorted and misinterpreted. The only thing we can conclude is that voters did not want to be part of the EU; EEA membership was not voted on.

attributes.action: Involve the British public in the fight against climate change
attributes.background: Our collective CO2 emissions are just those of each individual added together: each of us can and must limit our carbon footprint. As well as strong legislative action, the government should contact every home to explain the reality and danger of climate change and advise what each of us should do.
attributes.additional_details:
The WHO: "Climate change is among the greatest health risks of the 21st century." Personal actions should be prioritised by relative impact. Former DECC Chief Scientific Advisor Sir David MacKay urged these steps, among others:
Stop (or dramatically reduce) flying
Replace driving with public transport, cycling or walking
Reduce the energy needed to make products we buy (frequent new electronics & clothing, packaging)
Eat vegetarian 6/7 days
Turn heating to 15-17 degrees
Increase home insulation.

attributes.action: Subsidise train fares for 16-18 year olds in full-time education
attributes.background: My 2 sons best mode of transport to School is the train.We just paid £191 for my 15 year old for this term(6wks) and my 16yr old £382 for the same journey just because he turned 16!!He is still in the same school.16 -18 year olds in full time education should not be paying adult fares
attributes.additional_details: I challenged GWR( the rail company in this instance but other tail companies are also guilty) and I was told that there is a 16 - 25 year old 1/3rd off discount card which sounded brilliant except you can't activate it before 10am or you pay £12 flat day rate which works out more expensive than an adult season ticket.The 1/3rd discount card is a fraud as it does not do what it says!!. What 16 - to 25 year old goes anywhere meaningful daily after 10am? Students and workers take earlier trains.

attributes.action: Urge India to end abuse Human Rights abuse and initiate a peaceful dialogue
attributes.background:
Recent use of pellet guns on Kashmiri protestors has caused blindness of more than 150 people mostly children and 60 deaths.
Kashmir is under curfew and serious restrictions imposed on normal daily life for 45 days.
Indian refuses to initiate a dialogue
attributes.additional_details:
1. Sir Henry Harding, Governor General on behalf of the British sold Kashmir in 1846 to the Maharaja of Punjab Gulab Singh for 7,500,000 Indian Rupees who then gave it away as a dowry to his son in law Maharaja Hari Singh!
2. British citizensof Kashmiri origin have relatives, near and dear one suffering from the atrocities
3. Kashmir issue is the main flash point between the two nuclear powers, India and Pakistan. Violence only breads violence and plays in the hands of foreign agencies.

attributes.action: Basic First aid should be taught on the school curriculum.
attributes.background: People in the UK are unwilling or nervous to perform first aid and cpr when needed! If children were taught it at school, not only would this help those people injured in accidents or taken ill, it would also ease pressure on the already overstretched NHS.

attributes.action: End all government subsides and other financial aid to the fossil fuel industry.
attributes.background: The UK government provides the domestic fossil fuel industry with funds to the tune of £6 billion annually. This industry, endangering all of us by intensifying climate change, is getting money from our government at the expense of the taxpayer. This has to stop before it is too late.
attributes.additional_details:
Direct subsides are hard to calculate –  Reasonable mid-range figure is £6 billion annually, given by widely trusted sources such as the Independent and the Overseas Development Institute(ODI) however the UK claims not to have any using an irrational definition. The International Monetary Fund puts the figure much higher at £26b.
This petition's specific demand is that fossil fuel subsides, as defined by the ODI are to be abolished by 2020 and the extra revenue should be invested in clean energy.

attributes.action: Start education programmes in schools to highlight the recurrence of sexism
attributes.background: Sexism is an everyday problem that should be a concern to all of us. Even if we think that it is gradually improving as time moves on, it isn't. Catcalling and gender stereotyping and targeting is a huge issue, and much of the younger generation seems to find it acceptable because of many influences
attributes.additional_details: By introducing an education programme in secondary schools, we can teach everyone, no matter what gender, about everyday sexism, how it affects people and how it can be prevented. This will lead us one step closer to getting rid of sexism once and for all.

attributes.action: British Parliament help ex-military to find accommodation after service
attributes.background: Quite a lot of the people who are homeless are ex-military who have found it impossible to find accommodation and cannot get on a housing list due to having no postal address.
attributes.additional_details: Too many of the homeless are ex-military and find there is insufficient help for them to find a home after finishing military service. Without a permanent address it is almost impossible  to gain employment .Often they end up sleeping on the streets and alcoholism is a real threat as their life descends into a feeling of hopelessness and despair. Will you sign this petition to ask our Government to ensure there is adequate help for them before they finish their military service .
